wlclusters.modeling module#

class wlclusters.modeling.WLData(redshift, rin=None, rout=None, gplus=None, err_gplus=None, sigmacrit_inv=None, fl=None, cosmo=None, unit='proper')[source]#

Bases: object

A class to represent the weak lensing data for a galaxy cluster.

gplus#

Mean tangential shear for the weak lensing data.

Type:

numpy.ndarray

err_gplus#

Error on the mean tangential shear.

Type:

numpy.ndarray

rin_wl#

Inner radial bin edges (in Mpc).

Type:

numpy.ndarray

rout_wl#

Outer radial bin edges (in Mpc).

Type:

numpy.ndarray

radii_wl#

Combined radial bin edges (inner + outer) for weak lensing data.

Type:

numpy.ndarray

rref_wl#

Reference radius for each radial bin, defined as the average of rin_wl and rout_wl.

Type:

numpy.ndarray

rho_crit#

Critical density of the universe at the redshift of the cluster.

Type:

float

msigmacrit#

Mean inverse critical surface mass density.

Type:

float

fl#

Second-order correction factor for weak lensing.

Type:

float

Parameters:

  • redshift (float) – Redshift of the galaxy cluster.

  • rin (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Inner radii (in arcminutes) for the weak lensing bins.

  • rout (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Outer radii (in arcminutes) for the weak lensing bins.

  • gplus (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Mean tangential shear measurements.

  • err_gplus (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Errors on the mean tangential shear measurements.

  • sigmacrit_inv (float, optional) – Mean inverse critical surface mass density.

  • fl (float, optional) – Second-order correction factor (default is None, assuming first-order correction).

  • cosmo (astropy.cosmology, optional) – Cosmological model to be used (default is Planck15).

  • unit (str, optional) – Specifies whether the distances are in ‘proper’ or ‘comoving’ units (default is ‘proper’).

__init__ :

Initializes the WLData object and computes radial bin edges and other derived attributes.

wlclusters.modeling.WLmodel(WLdata, pmod)[source]#

PyMC (Theano) model for predicting the mean tangential shear profile for a given density profile at a specified redshift.

Parameters:

  • WLdata (WLData) – Object containing all the necessary information about the cluster. This includes: radii_wl : The radial bins for the weak lensing data. rho_crit : The critical density at the cluster’s redshift. msigmacrit : Mean inverse critical surface mass density for the cluster. fl : Second-order correction factor for weak lensing measurements.

  • pmod (list) – List of parameters for the density profile model. For an NFW profile, this typically includes: cdelta : Concentration parameter. rdelta : Scale radius parameter.

Returns:

  • gplus (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted mean tangential shear profile at the input radii.

  • rm (numpy.ndarray) – Radii bins after applying interpolation or extrapolation through the function get_radplus.

  • ev (numpy.ndarray) – Indices of the input data radii points within the new radii array, rm.

wlclusters.modeling.WLmodel_np(WLdata, pmod)[source]#

Numpy model for predicting the mean tangential shear profile for a given density profile at a specified redshift.

Parameters:

  • WLdata (WLData) – Object containing all the necessary information about the cluster. This includes: radii_wl : The radial bins for the weak lensing data. rho_crit : The critical density at the cluster’s redshift. msigmacrit : Mean inverse critical surface mass density for the cluster. fl : Second-order correction factor for weak lensing measurements.

  • pmod (list) – List of parameters for the density profile model. For an NFW profile, this typically includes: cdelta : Concentration parameter. rdelta : Scale radius parameter.

Returns:

  • gplus (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted mean tangential shear profile at the input radii.

  • rm (numpy.ndarray) – Radii bins after applying interpolation or extrapolation through the function get_radplus.

  • ev (numpy.ndarray) – Indices of the input data radii points within the new radii array, rm.

wlclusters.modeling.dsigma_trap(sigma, radii)[source]#

Computes Delta Sigma, the differential surface mass density, using numerical trapezoidal integration.

Parameters:

  • sigma (array) – Projected surface mass density values.

  • radii (array) – Radial distances.

Returns:

Differential surface mass density (Delta Sigma).

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.dsigma_trap_np(sigma, radii)[source]#

Computes Delta Sigma using numerical trapezoidal integration with NumPy.

Parameters:

  • sigma (array) – Projected surface mass density values.

  • radii (array) – Radial distances.

Returns:

Differential surface mass density (Delta Sigma).

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.get_radplus(radii, rmin=0.001, rmax=100.0, nptplus=19)[source]#

Generates additional interpolated/extrapolated radii points for integration.

Parameters:

  • radii (array) – Input radii.

  • rmin (float, optional) – Minimum radius value for extrapolation, defaults to 1e-3.

  • rmax (float, optional) – Maximum radius value for extrapolation, defaults to 1e2.

  • nptplus (int, optional) – Number of additional points, defaults to 19.

Returns:

  • radplus (array): Extended radii array.

  • rmeanplus (array): Midpoint of extended radii.

  • evalrad (array): Indices of original radii within extended radii array.

Return type:

tuple

wlclusters.modeling.get_shear(sigma, dsigma, mean_sigm_crit_inv, fl)[source]#

Computes the expected tangential shear profile using the Seitz and Schneider 1997 (or Umetsu 2020) formula.

Parameters:

  • sigma (array) – Projected surface mass density.

  • dsigma (array) – Differential surface mass density (Delta Sigma).

  • mean_sigm_crit_inv (float) – Mean inverse critical surface mass density.

  • fl (float) – Correction factor for second-order lensing effects.

Returns:

Mean tangential shear profile.

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.rho_nfw_cr(radii, pmod, delta=200.0)[source]#

Computes the Navarro-Frenk-White (NFW) density profile using PyMC (Theano) for a given radial distance array. Multiply the result by the critical density of the universe to get the physical density.

Parameters:

  • radii (array) – Radial distances in Mpc.

  • pmod (list) – Parameters model, containing concentration and radius/mass.

  • delta (float, optional) – Overdensity parameter, defaults to 200.

Returns:

NFW density profile divided by the critical density of the universe.

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.rho_nfw_cr_np(radii, c200, r200, delta=200.0)[source]#

Computes the Navarro-Frenk-White (NFW) density profile using NumPy for a given radial distance array. Multiply the result by the critical density of the universe to get the physical density.

Parameters:

  • radii (array) – Radial distances in Mpc.

  • c200 (float) – Concentration parameter.

  • r200 (float) – Radius parameter (in Mpc).

  • delta (float, optional) – Overdensity parameter, defaults to 200.

Returns:

NFW density profile divided by the critical density of the universe.

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.rho_to_sigma(radii_bins, rho)[source]#

Projects a 3D density profile to compute the surface mass density using PyMC (Theano).

Parameters:

  • radii_bins (array) – Binned radial distances.

  • rho (array) – 3D density profile values.

Returns:

Projected surface mass density in units of M_sun * Mpc**-2.

Return type:

array

wlclusters.modeling.rho_to_sigma_np(radii_bins, rho)[source]#

Projects a 3D density profile to compute the surface mass density using NumPy.

Parameters:

  • radii_bins (array) – Binned radial distances.

  • rho (array) – 3D density profile values.

Returns:

Projected surface mass density in units of M_sun * Mpc**-2.

Return type:

array
